STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 15, 2022
Savator Selden-Johnson
Kent County DHHS
121 Franklin SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507-1233
RE: License #: CP410201222
Kent County DHHS
121 Franklin SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507-1233
Dear Ms. Selden-Johnson:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 8, 2022. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Settlement Agreement
(MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is
in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The facility was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The facility did not request consultation during this review.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care.
The agency has not submitted any acceptable corrective action plans not
related to maltreatment during this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported the agency continues to be in compliance with child
placing rules, MISEP and contract requirements. The Chief Administrator
assessment noted agency staff are currently in the process of completing adoption
training and are working with West Michigan Partnership for Children (WMPC) and
the Licensing Coalition in efforts to recruit and retain foster families. Kent County
foster care services are provided through thePerformance Based Funding Pilot and
all foster care services for Kent County is provided to children/families through the
WMPC, the oversight entity for the Private Agency Foster Care providers. The Chief
Administrator expressed confidence the agency will continue to meet expectations
for all licensing rules, policy and contract requirements.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff via telephone. The staff felt supported by
their supervisors as well as their coworkers. Staff reported that supervision is
available as needed outside of the scheduled conferences. Staff reported feeling
somewhat frustrated when licensing a home for ICPC and the family does not end up
getting placement. Staff understands that is how it is sometimes but feels badly for
4

the family. The agency has regularly scheduled Monday meetings for services staff
who can attend. Staff reported those meetings are helpful. In addition, there are
regularly scheduled trainings/presentations on Thursdays that staff find helpful. Staff
reported no areas of need.
VI. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
____________6/15/2022_________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 15, 2022
